fields.description: It's confusing both to users and admin in terms of end-behavior that Confluence users need "add" page permission to edit pages in a space. It would be clearer to separate "add" from "edit" perms.
fields.summary: Confluence Space Perms - "Add" should be separated from "Edit"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Approve/decline requests shown in a Filter Result gadget doesn't Approve/Decline the request.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a workflow, which includes a Status for Approval
 # Create a dashboard with *Filter request* gadget.
 # Create an issue

 * Observe that the issue is listed in the Dashboard ( Filter request gadget )
 * Click on the three dots on the right-hand side of the issue
 * If you are approver, you will be presented with a lot of options, including approve, Decline
 * Click on approve, observe that no action is being taken
 * Click on Decline and no action is taken again.
 * Clicking on other options transitions, assign to me, add a comment, etc works well.

Manually accessing the issue and approving/ declining the issue works.
h3. Expected Results

The request should be approved or Declined accordingly.
h3. Actual Results

Nothing happens. No action is taken.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Approve/decline requests shown in a Filter Result gadget doesn't Approve/Decline the request

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The set of documents on Jira and Confluence sizing and the recommendations for these applications as applied to AWS contain some inconsistencies internally, and between each other.

The documents in question are
 * [Jira Data Center size profiles|https://confluence.atlassian.com/enterprise/jira-data-center-size-profiles-955171062.html]

 * [Infrastructure recommendations for enterprise Jira instances on AWS|https://confluence.atlassian.com/enterprise/infrastructure-recommendations-for-enterprise-jira-instances-on-aws-969532459.html]

 * [Confluence Data Center load profiles|https://confluence.atlassian.com/enterprise/confluence-data-center-load-profiles-946603546.html]

 * [Infrastructure recommendations for enterprise Confluence instances on AWS|https://confluence.atlassian.com/enterprise/infrastructure-recommendations-for-enterprise-confluence-instances-on-aws-965544795.html]

The inconsistencies noted are
 * *Document names:* 
 ** _Jira Data Center *size* profiles_ vs.
 ** _Confluence Data Center *load* profiles_
 * *Instance size descriptors:* 
 ** The Confluence load profile page switches between initialisms (*S, M, L, XL*) and full-word descriptors (*Small, Medium, Large, Xlarge*); the corresponding AWS infrastructure page uses only full words
 ** The Jira profile page uses only full-word descriptors; its corresponding AWS infrastructure page switches indiscriminately between initialisms ('Jira L') and full words ('Jira XLarge')
 * *Possible inconsistencies in hardware recommendations**:*
 ** In the Jira AWS infrastructure guide, there is a suspiciously large difference in nodes suggested between Jira 8.5 and 8.13 on many of the recommendations (e.g., in *Recommendation for XLarge Jira instance: Recommendations for best performance and reliability,* we see six (6) nodes recommended for Jira 8.5, but two (2) recommended for Jira 8.13. Without explanation as to why fundamentally similar softwares have such large differences, it is confusing and less credible than we might like.
 ** Also in the Jira AWS infrastructure guide, we see the following:
 *** 
{quote}best performance, 8.13 Jira L, should be on c5.9: 36vcpu 72GB 3nodesbest performance, 8.13 Jira XLarge, should be on c5.4: 16vcpu 32GB 2nodes{quote}
 *** Again, without further explanation, it is counter-intuitive that a XLarge instance should require so much less resources than a Large instance.
fields.summary: Inconsistencies in Sizing and AWS Documentation

The affected versions of Jira Server and Data Center are before version 8.5.14, from version 8.6.0 before 8.13.6, and from version 8.14.0 before 8.15.0.

 

*Affected versions:*

*Fixed versions:*
 * 8.5.14
 * 8.13.6
 * 8.15.0
fields.summary: Jira is affected by Tomcat CVE-2020-13943

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When attaching a PDF file with version 1.3 or 1.4 without embedded fonts in an issue, when clicking in PDF thumb to preview the file, Jira shows only a blank page.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Installed a fresh Jira instance on version 8.18.1.
 # Created an empty project.
 # Created an issue.
 # Attached to this issue, a PDF file with versions 1.3, 1.4, and 1.5.
 # When tried to preview these files from the issue screen, only PDF with version 1.5 opened properly, the PDF files on versions 1.3 and 1.4 only showed a blank page.
 # Performed the same steps above in Chrome, Firefox and got the same results.
 # Opening all 3 PDF files outside of Jira using any PDF reader, it was possible to view the file content normally.
 # It was tested in few more Jira versions as 8.11.1, 8.13.6, 8.13.9, all with the same results

h3. Expected Results

Being able to preview the PDF file with their respective content.
h3. Actual Results

In the Logs and also in the HAR file it wasn't possible to see any error, only the message below in the Output Console.
{noformat}
DEPRECATED JS - JQuery.fn.spin has been deprecated since 7.9.4 and will be removed in 9.0.0. Use <aui-spinner> instead.   
 clearMessage@http://localhost:48111/j8111/s/97339cc2146a5fbcff9fbca4b73a670a-CDN/-v59hgg/811002/6411e0087192541a09d88223fb51a6a0/8.0.0/_/download/batch/com.atlassian.jira.jira-fileviewer-plugin:atlassian-fileviewer/com.atlassian.jira.jira-fileviewer-plugin:atlassian-fileviewer.js?locale=en-BR:4650:52 batch.js:244:46{noformat}
Below, a screenshot with current results
h3. Workaround
h4. Convert the file
 # Open the PDF file with version 1.3 or 1.4 in any PDF Reader.
 # Save or Export the file in another file format like Word.
 # Open the file exported/saved in step 2 and then export it again to PDF using 1.5 version or higher.

h4. Use browser's PDF viewer
* Right click and 'Open in new tab/window'. This causes it to use the browser's PDF viewer and not the one built into Jira.

h3. Note from users
Credit to [~26325d6c4916] 
{quote}
The issue seems to occur whenever fonts where used in the PDF that are not embedded within the file itself.
This provides two solutions (we could think of) that need to be considered when generating PDFs:

Make sure the software that embeds PDFs embeds the fonts within the file.
Alternatively: The PDF shouldn't contain any actual text but just paths - however, this likely makes Text unselectable.
{quote}
and [~640024a5d536]
{quote}
I did some extensive research on this. Pdf's earlier than Version 1.5 use the accessibility plugin (Adobe) which was deactivated somewhere in May this year after 20 years being EOL. One of the things this plugin provided was supply fonts and formats to PDF viewing software.
There were two ways this plugin could be used in a program: Embed it in your own (small piece of code/library) or call the weblink provided by Adobe (which downloads this plugin every time again).

Programmers who would spare some bytes of code or were simply lazy implemented the last option. 
Although Adobe announced the EOL and also announced the deactivation of the weblink, programmers forgot about the implementation in their software and never fixed it. 

That is why PDF's V1.4 and lower don't render the Fonts any more when software is using the second option.

Nevertheless, complaining about this, at Atlassian, I found out that Atlassian doesn't feel responsible for this because there is a Workaround (saving and opening the PDF, so not using the preview from Jira for PDF's < Version 1.5 and replacing the PDF with a higher Version).

 Note:  PDF Version 1.5 (maybe V1.6 too, but could not find documentation about that) still implemented the new and the old way to render Fonts, so therefore, depending on the software  the PDF was created with, used the old  way and doesn't render, but as I found out, the most programs switched to the new way.
{quote}
fields.summary: Jira cannot preview/render PDF attachments with versions 1.3 and 1.4 without embedded fonts

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Copying colored text from a text field (with wiki-renderer) or comment and then pasting it into another field(with wiki-renderer), or comment loses original color formatting.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create some colored text(e.g. \{color:red}AAAAAAAA\{color} on Text Mode)
 # Switch to Visual Mode, copy the colored text.
 # Paste it in another text field(with wiki-renderer) in Visual Mode

h3. Expected Results

The color formatting should be kept
h3. Actual Results

The color formatting is lost.
h4. Screencast reproducing the issue

[^Chrome 2021-08-13 at 15.19.54.mov]

[^Firefox 2021-08-13 at 15.22.21.mov]
h3. Workaround

Use Firefox. The issue didn't occur with this browser.
fields.summary: Pasting colored text into field(or comment) loses original color formatting on Google Chrome

fields.description: Regulated industries often require audits of permissions, and continually need to update their permissions across many products. Having the ability to manage permissions outside of a "grant" or "add" scenario would be beneficial for many of these customers, since there are times when users or groups need to be explicitly removed rather than granted permission. Adding a subtraction option to the current permission model would allow for more flexibility in these scenarios.
fields.summary: Subtractive Permissions

fields.description:
*Description of Problem* 

In Jira 8.x, the thumbnail images are likely stored in PNG format.
{code}
# file /var/atlassian/application-data/jira/data/attachments/AAA/10000/AAA-9/thumbs/_thumb_10000.png
/var/atlassian/application-data/jira/data/attachments/AAA/10000/AAA-9/thumbs/_thumb_10000.png: PNG image data, 200 x 133, 8-bit/color RGB, non-interlaced
{code}

However, in this document, it is said that all thumbnail images in Jira are stored in JPEG format.

[Configuring file attachments|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver0813/configuring-file-attachments-1027138635.html]
{quote}
All thumbnail images are stored in JPEG format in the attachments directory, together with the original attachments. The thumbnail images are denoted by '_thumb_' in their file names.
{quote}
 !jira-thumbnail-file-format.png|thumbnail! 


The document should be fixed.

*Suggested Resolution* 

The document should be fixed like this.

[Configuring file attachments|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver0813/configuring-file-attachments-1027138635.html]
> All thumbnail images are stored in PNG format in the attachments directory, together with the original attachments. The thumbnail images are denoted by '_thumb_' in their file names.
fields.summary: (Documentation issue)Thumbnail image file format is PNG in Jira 8.x

fields.description:
Hello Team

In the [Perfomance and Scale testing|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver0813/performance-and-scale-testing-1027138717.html] documentation, we have the following chart under the "Jira 8.13 performance" section.

*Response times for Jira actions:*
 !ALL_ACTIONS.png|width=297,height=244!

and further, in the documentation, we mention the following:
{code:java}
All Actions  -  A mean of all actions performed during a single test run.
{code}
 
One of the customers has the following questions:
 * The calculated mean of all action is calculated in which way?
 It's the sum of the result of every single action divided by the number of the actions or there's some default value as constant to take care of?
I ask you this, because if I sum the results of every action and then I divide by the number of the action (11) the result is about 1350 ms, instead of the about 350/400 shown in the graphic.


 * The result of every action is the result of the number of times an action is performed during a single test run?
i.e: the "view board" action has a result of about 750 ms: this is the result of the action repeated 10 times (so, 75 ms x 10 times), or of the single action?


Please help answer the following questions from the customer.

Thank you.
fields.summary: Clarification about the mean calculation of the "ALL ACTIONS" item discussed in the "Perfomance and Scale testing" documentation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When editing an issue, if you paste the value *White,Blue* as a label it will add a label *"White,Blue"*.

This suggestion is to allow customer to determine a separator to produce two labels *White* and *Blue* on the example above.

For reference, currently this does not work with space either - it attempts to create with space and errors out.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On issue view, add labels by pasting contents with a comma like *White,Blue*.

h3. Expected Results

Two labels are added: *White* and *Blue.*

*!image-2021-08-12-10-08-01-588.png|width=501,height=45!*
h3. Actual Results

One label *White,Blue* is created.

!image-2021-08-12-10-06-09-130.png|width=428,height=56!
h3. Workaround

Paste the labels individually.
fields.summary: Allow comma to split labels when editing an issue and pasting label with comma

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Anonymous user are unable to view issue attachments. Getting error message "Ouch! We can't load the image.".
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add one image attachment to an Issue on Jira software *v8.15.0* or above.
 # Go to Project settings > Permissions > Scheme > Project permissions.
 # Set "*Browse Projects*" permission to "*Group*" as "*Anyone on the web*"
 # Copy the issue URL _<Jira base URL>/browse/<issue-key>_ and try to access it in a different / incognito browser.(In this case we are viewing the issue as an anonymous user by not logging to the Jira application).Please refer to the attached screenshot.
 # You should be able to view the issue details, but clicking on attachments results in "error message "*Ouch! We can't load the image.*".

h3. Expected Results

Any user on the web can view the issue attachments after setting "*Browse Projects*" permission to "Group" as "*Anyone on the web*"
h3. Actual Results

Anonymous users were unable to view issue attachments.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Viewing issue attachments as an anonymous user results in error message "Ouch! We can't load the image."

fields.description:
We would like to have favicons changed on board level, not only site/space level.

When we have multiple boards open for our project, like
 * incident board
 * kanban board
 * steering board
 * etc.

those cannot be distinguished anymore by browser favicon.

Unfortunately, the page favicon is all you see when you are using pinned browser tabs, so all pinned Jira tabs/boards look the same, which makes working with them cumbersome.

It would be quite easy if we could assign different favicons to the boards we have.
fields.summary: Change Favicon on Jira Board Level

fields.description:
Affected versions of Atlassian Jira Server and Data Center allow remote attackers to read particular files via a path traversal vulnerability in the /WEB-INF/web.xml endpoint.

 

The affected versions are before version 8.5.14, from version 8.6.0 before 8.13.6, and from version 8.14.0 before 8.16.1.

 

*Affected versions:*
 * version < 8.5.14
 * 8.6.0 ≤ version < 8.13.6
 * 8.14.0 ≤ version < 8.16.1

*Fixed versions:*
 * 8.5.14
 * 8.13.6
 * 8.16.1
 * 8.17.0  



h4. Mitigation
Until the upgrade you may use the following workaround to protect the files:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/workaround-for-cve-2019-15004-979416164.html
fields.summary: Limited Remote File Read in Jira Software Server - CVE-2021-26086

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Re-appearance of the deleted resolution code Done when an issue is moved to a columns associated to it in a Board. 
 Resolution is removed from global resolution list (https://<sitename>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/ViewResolutions.jspa) and re-appears and becomes available for users if there's a drop-down for it on a screen.
 *Note:* the same may apply to other resolutions.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Create a project an a board. It must be using the simplified workflow.
 Delete the Resolution "Done" from the global resolution list (https://<sitename>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/ViewResolutions.jspa).
 On the board, move an issue into the "Done" column.
h3. Expected Results

Either an error message stating it could not be updated.
 OR
 Don't let admin delete a resolution that is associated to a board column.
h3. Actual Results

The Resolution code will be automatically re-created with description: GreenHopper Managed Resolution.
 !image-2021-08-10-14-19-24-468.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

*Option 1.* Do not use Simplified Workflow. Change the workflow associated to the board and it will ask for the resolution value.

*Option 2.*
 * Edit the Simplified workflow transition. Remove the Pre-existing post-function for the transition to done (click the X on the right):
 !image-2021-08-10-14-27-12-160.png|thumbnail! 
 * Create a new post-function *Update Issue Field* to set the *Resolution* to the value of your choice.

 ** Make sure this post-function sits at the top of the post functions so it happens first.
fields.summary: Re-appearance of the deleted resolution code Done

fields.description:
*Form Data* section is showing credentials in plain text,
 - Logout from Jira and try logging in again with developer tools open and on network tab watch for login.jsp
 - once you try to login, you will see that username and password are visible in plain text in *Form Data section* of network response.
 - This is irrespective of HTTP/ HTTPS

!image-2021-08-10-19-49-28-668.png!

It will be good to have an advanced way of managing it or a mechanism to encrypt the credentials.
fields.summary: Form Data is showing credentials in plain text

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
While reindexing Jira(which is configured with Postgres mainly), it fails with : "Cannot change transaction isolation level in the middle of a transaction", somewhere at the end of whole process.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
- Install Jira 8.13 and above with Postgres.
- Populate set of data on this environment or restore back up from existing reproducible environment.
- Re-index.

(i) We have not been able to locally reproduce it as of date :(

h3. Expected Results

Reindex should succeed.

h3. Actual Results

It fails with following error:
{code:java}
Caused by: com.atlassian.jira.transaction.TransactionRuntimeException: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericTransactionException: Error occurred while starting transaction. (Cannot change transaction isolation level in the middle of a transaction.)
	at com.atlassian.jira.transaction.TransactionSupportImpl.beginTxn(TransactionSupportImpl.java:54)
	at com.atlassian.jira.transaction.TransactionSupportImpl.startedTransaction(TransactionSupportImpl.java:46)
	at com.atlassian.jira.transaction.TransactionSupportImpl.begin(TransactionSupportImpl.java:31)
[....clipped....]
	at com.atlassian.jira.versioning.EntityVersioningManagerImpl.getRelatedCommentVersions(EntityVersioningManagerImpl.java:137)
[....clipped....]
Caused by: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericTransactionException: Error occurred while starting transaction. (Cannot change transaction isolation level in the middle of a transaction.)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.TransactionUtil.beginLocalTransaction(TransactionUtil.java:296)
	at com.atlassian.core.ofbiz.util.CoreTransactionUtil.begin(CoreTransactionUtil.java:54)
	at com.atlassian.jira.transaction.TransactionSupportImpl.beginTxn(TransactionSupportImpl.java:52)
	... 22 more
Caused by: org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: Cannot change transaction isolation level in the middle of a transaction.
	at org.apache.commons.dbcp2.DelegatingConnection.setTransactionIsolation(DelegatingConnection.java:573)
	at org.apache.commons.dbcp2.DelegatingConnection.setTransactionIsolation(DelegatingConnection.java:573)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.jdbc.interceptors.connection.DelegatingConnection.setTransactionIsolation(DelegatingConnection.java:93)
	at com.atlassian.jira.ofbiz.sql.ConnectionWrapper.setTransactionIsolation(ConnectionWrapper.java:112)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.TransactionUtil.beginLocalTransaction(TransactionUtil.java:289)
{code}

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available. Please contact support for investigation steps available as of now.
fields.summary: Reindexing in jira + Postgres frequently fails with : "Cannot change transaction isolation level in the middle of a transaction"

fields.description:
As an user I'd like to have the possibility to configure iframes for individual issues, not just entire project, this is possible for Cloud using third-party app [Figma for Jira|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1217865/figma-for-jira?tab=overview&hosting=cloud] but not on DC.

Also, [Iframes&Embedded Content for Jira issues|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1222088/iframes-embedded-content-for-jira-issues?tab=versions&hosting=server] is not supported on DC and not available for newer versions of Jira, p.e. 8.13)
fields.summary: Ability to configure iframes for individual issues, not just entire project.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using a screen reader to create an issue, the button "Configure Fields" to add additional fields on the screen can not be accessed by keyboard users.

Environments used for the test
 1. Chrome 92.0.4515.107/Windows 10/JAWS 2021
 2. Firefox 90.0.2/Windows 10/JAWS 2021
 3. Chrome 92.0.4515.107/Mac OS/Mac Voice Reader.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Click the button to create a new issue
 2. Using only the keyboard, press <tab> until the focus is on the "Configure Fields" button
h3. Expected Results

The screen reader should identify the button "Configure Fields"
 We should be able to navigate the window, hear the name of the field, and if it is selected or not selected
 We should be able to click at the field to select or unselect the field
h3. Actual Results

We are not able to move inside the "Configure Fields" window using the keyboard.
 For Firefox, the JAWS reader can not identify any field from the Edit View window and when reaching the "Configure Fields", we can not expand the window.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

 
|Firefox/Jaws|Chrome/Jaws|Mac|
|Press the button to create a new Issue|Press the button to create a new Issue|Press the button to create a new Issue|
|Press <tab> until reaching the "Configure Fields" button on the Edit Issue window|Press <tab> until reaching the "Configure Fields" button on the Edit Issue window|Press <tab> until reaching the "Configure Fields" button on the Edit Issue window|
|The reader does not read the identification of any field, but we can observe that the focus is on the "Configure Fields" button (x)|We will hear "_Configure fields_
 _Configure fields button_
 _To activate press enter_"|We will hear "_Entering toolbar._
 _Configure fields_
 _Configure fields, button_
 _You are currently on a button._
 _To click this button, press Control-Option-Space"_|
|Press <enter>|Press <Enter>|Press <Control-Option-Space>|
|Nothing happens (x)|The pop-up window with the fields is presented|The pop-up window with the fields is presented|
| |Pressing <tab>, <arrow up>, <arrow down> has no effect. We can not select any field. (x)|Pressing <tab>, <arrow up>, <arrow down> has no effect. We can not select any field. (x)|
fields.summary: Accessibility - Keyboard users can not access the "Configure Fields" options when editing an issue

fields.description:
Hello Team,

The REST API documentation > https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/REST/8.18.1/ contains the API for *Bulk delete custom fields* but this feature is only enabled for DC as per https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-37773.
Can we please update this documentation accordingly so that it doesn’t create confusions among the customers.
Using this API in Jira server throws the error "Feature not available in Server or jira.customfields.bulk.delete feature flag is turned off."
fields.summary: REST API documentation requires an update

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

We need a better solution to manage the sorting order of statuses.

When Jira has a great number of Statuses (+100) it is very time-consuming to manage the order of each status that relates to different projects and workflows one by one.

As this reflects directly on filters and JQL this order can be very important.

When working with several projects and different teams, managing this order can be very confusing and quickly get out of hand.

h3. Suggested Solution
Ability to change the status order in JQL filter results based on which project is associated with the filter itself.
fields.summary: Better management of Status sequence

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using a screen reader to view an issue, the menu of options icon represented by "..." for sessions like Attachments and subtasks do not receive focus and therefore cannot be reached and operated by keyboard users.

Environments used for the test
 1. Chrome 92.0.4515.107/Windows 10/JAWS 2021
 2. Firefox 90.0.2/Windows 10/JAWS 2021
 3. Chrome 92.0.4515.107/Mac OS/Mac Voice Reader.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Edit an Issue with Attachments
 * Press tab until reach Attachments session
 * Press tab to reach the options menu "..."

h3. Expected Results
 * Reach the options menu and hit Space or Enter to expand it

h3. Actual Results
 * We can not reach the options menu with the keyboard as it does not receive focus

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Accessibility - keyboard users can not reach the 3 dots icon to expand the menu of options at the issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When enabling '*Secure: forced download of attachments for all browsers*' option in the '*Internet Explorer MIME Sniffing Security Hole Workaround Policy*', the attachments are still opened in the browser instead of being downloaded.

Reference KB article: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/modify-attachment-security-policy-1037993039.html]
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to '*Jira Administration !https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskserver0315/files/957506624/957506625/1/1536815901559/cog_icon.png|width=18! -> System*'.
 # Select the '*Edit Settings*' button near the top right corner.
 # Locate the option '*Internet Explorer MIME Sniffing Security Hole Workaround Policy*'.
 # Enable '*Secure*: forced download of attachments for all browsers'
 # Restart the browser and try to open any attachment from Jira

h3. Expected Results

The attachment is automatically downloaded locally on the client
h3. Actual Results

The attachment opens directly in the browser
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Enabling 'Secure: forced download of attachments for all browsers' option has no effect and attachments still open directly in the browser

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The *Hide completed issues older than* option in the general settings for Kanban Boards are limited to 1, 2, and 4 weeks. To see issues older than these time windows you're forced to use the _show all_ option that overloads the Board.
h3. Proposed solution

Let the user customize the time for completed issues that teams want to have visible on their Board. Another solution would be to expanding the options for this function.
h3. Workaround

As a workaround, you can use the _show all_ option, and adjust your Saved Filter to exclude unwanted issues by including an (e.g.) {{resolved >= -10w}} in your JQL.
fields.summary: Ability to customize the "Hide completed issues older than"

When creating a numbered list it has been identified that if you delete a list item nested within another numbered list and attempt to recreate it will break the numbering sequence resulting in the proceeding numbered items to start back at 1

 ### example text
 ## example text

 ## 
 ### breaking text

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create numbered list with nested numbered lists within each list item
 # Highlight numbered nested list item and hit "backspace" and then hit "backspace again. which will result in the curser on the previous line.
 # Hit "Enter" and then "TAB" to create the nested numbered item and enter text.
 ** You will notice on this new line there is additional space between the line above compared to the other listed items.
 ** Additionally you will see a number "1" for each tab into the numbered list

i.e. 1.       1.        1.         1. Some text
h3. Expected Results

Expected results would appear as follows:

Example text

h3. Actual Results

 #### example text
 ### example text
 #### example text
 ### example text
 #### example text
 ### example text

 ###

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If a roadmap (plans) takes more than 10 seconds to load on Jira, it will fail to load when embedded in a Confluence page.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an advanced roadmap on jira (plan) for a new project
 # create 11k issues or more on that project
 # paste the roadmap's link to a confluence page and publish it

h3. Expected Results

The page should load, taking a similar time as Jira does to load the roadmap
h3. Actual Results

The roadmap fails to load, with an error after 10 seconds. The request to {{/wiki/plugins/servlet/portfolio-proxy}} fails with a 504 (gateway timeout) after 10 seconds.
h3. Workaround

_Workaround 1:_ Decrease the number of issues listed in the plan, in order to decrease the loading time to 10s or less.

_Workaround 2:_ Change the socket timeout in Confluence to 60000 from UI -> General Configuration.

Just in case this does not work for you if you are working with an older version of Confluence, please add the following parameters in the Confluence setenv.sh
{code:java}
CATALINA_OPTS="-Datlassian.http.socket.timeout=60000 ${CATALINA_OPTS}"
{code}
and then restart Confluence.
fields.summary: Advanced roadmaps from Jira timeouts after 10s

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Tempo Timesheet showing wrong Time on the day of daylight switch(DST).
 The issue was noticed only on the day of daylight switch time (DST), ie: *28th March 2021* between *2:00 am* and *11:00 pm*.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Issue replicated by following the below steps:
 # Set the Sytem time zone as Central Erupean Summer time, ie: *GMT + 2*
 # Access *Jira Administration(Settings) >> System*
 # Set *Default user time zone* as *(GMT+00:00) GMT*
 # Install [Tempo Timesheets - Time Tracking & Reports|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/6572/tempo-timesheets-time-tracking-reports/version-history] plugin *v10.17.4*.
 # From the Menubar select  *Tempo >> My Work*
 # Select date as *"28th March 2021"*
 # Make a "*Log Time*" entry by choosing Date as *"28/Mar/2021"* and Time frame as *07.00 AM - 07:15 AM*
 # Click on "*Log Time*".
 # You will notice that the entry made will automatically shift one hour ahead to *6.00 AM* in the Calendar
 # For more details, please refer [here|https://getsupport.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/6308795/6308795_Tempo+plugin+issue+screen+recording.mov] to the issue replication screen recording.

h3. Expected Results

Calendar register's the Log Time entry based on the input time frame.
h3. Actual Results

Calendar register's the Log Time entry incorrectly (One hour ahead of the input time frame.)
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Selecting the day of day light switch time (DST) on Tempo Timesheet showing wrong Time in Calendar.

fields.description:
Currently Jira only allow us to update a field value using post functions during a issue's transition or using add-ons. 

Need a functionality (automation rule, condition or post-function) that updates the value a linked issue's field always that the value of its parent issue's field is updates when not transitioning the issue.
fields.summary: Update linked issue when parent issue is updated

fields.description:
*Proposal*

When Jira authentication times out in the background it would be far less disruptive if a hover / popup screen was used to allow user to login, rather than redirecting to a separate login page.

 

*Background*

I use Jira every day at work, with multiple tabs open on multiple issues / screens. By far the most frustrating issue I have is when typing up a large response to an issue, I hit submit only to be redirected to a login page because it's logged me out in the background. After I hit ok for the saved login to be entered, it sometimes redirects me back to where I was but all my entered text has now been lost.

Every other modern web platform I work with allows login in a popup, such that when it's accepted I'm still on the same screen in the browser with no lost state.
fields.summary: Login with popup rather than redirect

fields.description:
The DefaultOSWorkflowConfigurator class in Jira Server and Jira Data Center before version 8.18.1 allows remote attackers who can trick a system administrator to import their malicious workflow to execute arbitrary code via a Remote Code Execution (RCE) vulnerability which allowed for various problematic OSWorkflow classes to be used as part of workflows. The fix for this issue blocks usage of unsafe conditions, validators, functions and registers that are build-in into OSWorkflow library and other Jira dependencies. Atlassian-made functions or functions provided by 3rd party plugins are not affected by this fix.

To disable the protection in Jira 8.18.1 and above administrators can enable the dark feature flag: {{com.atlassian.jira.security.LegacyJiraTypeResolver.WARN_ONLY.enabled}}.
h4. Note

Workaround for the vulnerability is available on Jira -8.5.18 and 8.13.9- 8.5.19 and 8.13.11.

To enable protection in Jira 8.5.19+ and  8.13.11+ administrators can enable the dark feature flag:
 {{com.atlassian.jira.security.LegacyJiraTypeResolver.block.unknown.functions.enabled}}
fields.summary: Remote code execution in workflow import - CVE-2017-18113

fields.description:
All current Jira versions use the Apache httpclient 4.5.x for outbound https connections. This version is not compatible with the combination https and SOCKS proxy, i.e. Java properties {{https.proxyHost}} and {{socksProxyHost}}.

Java 8 itself supports it, i.e will use the proxy for the highest possible protocol: [https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/technotes/guides/net/proxies.html]

But the httpclient 4.5 does not, causing unexpected results. See [https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HTTPCLIENT-1966]

This has been fixed in 5.0.
fields.summary: Use Apache httpclient 5.x with Jira to support https and SOCKS proxy combination

com.atlassian.jira.cluster.distribution.localq.LocalQCacheOpSender$UnrecoverableFailure: java.rmi.MarshalException: error marshalling arguments; nested exception is: 
	java.net.SocketException: Broken pipe (Write failed)
	at com.atlassian.jira.cluster.distribution.localq.rmi.LocalQCacheOpRMISender.send(LocalQCacheOpRMISender.java:90){code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Setup a [Jira Data Center with 2 or more nodes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/installing-jira-data-center-938846870.html]
# Add two entries in the /etc/hosts file with both external and internal IP mappings, for example:{code}
172.20.40.245 node01
127.0.0.1 node01
{code}
The reason for this behavior is a duplicate entry in the etc/hosts file containing an external and internal IP causing a loop.
 The problem can be explained as follows:
 * Each node uses its own hostname to communicate with each other
 * In case of duplicated entries in the hosts file, the hostname is resolved to the loopback IP 127.0.1.1
 * Due to this, master detects that 127.0.1.1 is trying to communicate with it, and it recognizes that IP as itself instead of secondary
 * The same happens to the secondary node
 * So basically the nodes are not able to communicate with each other and end up in a loop
h3. Expected Results
Provide more details about the problem with the error message. ie, any indication of the host communication failure or loop.

h3. Actual Results
The error messages are generic and offer no indication that the hostname has a localhost address and an external address just by looking at the cache replication errors alone


h3. Workaround

Check /etc/hosts file for duplicated entries, for example:
{code:java}
127.0.1.1 ip-node-1
127.0.0.1 ip-node-1
{code}
You may also check:
[JIRA - Only One Node Will Start in Cluster|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/jira-7-6-x-only-one-node-will-start-in-cluster-956699096.html]
fields.summary: Cluster Cache replication health check fails with error SocketException: Broken pipe exception

fields.description:
h3. Issue

If a component or a version is renamed while some Jira issues were already linked to them, it is currently not possible to tell from the issue history that the component or the version was renamed.

The reason behind is that Jira issues are linked to components (or versions) via the component ID (or version ID), and not by their name. So, if a component (or version) is renamed at the project level, from the Jira issue perspective, the component (or version) was not changed.

Because of this current behavior, it is not possible for Jira users to tell which issue(s) were impacted by the component (or version) renaming.
h3. Suggestion

A few suggestions:
 - reflect the renaming of components (and versions) in the issue history tab (if an issue was already linked to them)
 - or create a new JQL function to search for issues which were already linked to the component (or version) before they were renamed
fields.summary: Make it possible to tell if a Jira issue was already associated to a component (or version) before this component (or version) was renamed

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

On the reports page, the selection lists for the "Sprint" and the "Story Points" cannot be operated with the keyboard when using the JAWS screen reader in Firefox browser.

The environment used for the test:
 * Windows 10
 * JAWS 2021
 * Local Sandbox Jira DC 8.13.3
 * Board with 3 Sprints (1 closed, 2 active sprints "Sample Sprint 1", "Sample Sprint 2", "Sample Sprint 3")
 * Chrome 92.0.4515.107
 * Firefox 90.0.2.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Open the Board, select Reports > "BurnDown Menu";
 * Press <tab> until reaching the Sprint Selection box;
 * We will hear:
{quote}_Sample Sprint 3 link_
{quote}
 * Press <space> or <enter>;
 * We will hear the pressed key (enter or space);

h3. Expected Results

(observed on the same environment using Chrome)
 * The available sprints will be listed;
 * We will hear:
{quote}_Selected Sample Sprint 3_
 _listbox_
 _list_
 _Sample Sprint 2_
 _to move to an item press the arrow keys_
{quote}
 * Pressing <arrow down> <arrow up> it is possible to navigate the options, hearing each one of them;
 * Pressing <Enter> selects the option.

h3. Actual Results

When pressing <space> key:
 * The browser scroll down the screen instead of expanding the list of options;

When pressing <enter> key:
 * Nothing happens.

h3. Workaround

Option 1: Use Chrome 92.0.4515.107 instead of Firefox 90.0.2;
 Option 2: Use MacOS with the VoiceOver reader.
fields.summary: Accessibility - Cannot select Sprint or Estimation method on the reports when using JAWS Reader

When using the AWS Cloud Quick Start, when starting Jira it does ask for:
 * Setup application properties
 ** Title
 ** Mode
 ** Base URL
 * Specify your license key
 * Set up the Administrator account
 * Set up email notifications

The documentation at [Getting started with Jira Data Center on AWS|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/getting-started-with-jira-data-center-on-aws-938846966.html] mention the possibility to add some [automation|https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/dc-deployments-automation/src/master/README.md] using [jira-config.properties file|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/use-the-jira-config-properties-file-to-customize-an-aws-quick-start-deployment-993922385.html] to define default values for the properties existent at the [file jpm.xml (located in the <jira-application-dir>/WEB-INF/classes subdirectory of the JIRA application installation directory)|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/advanced-jira-application-configuration-938847847.html], however only jira.title is available on the JPM.xml.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

A hidden, from the Backlog page, Story card with missing transition icons will be created while an error message happens due to a user's project permission.
 
 While trying to create a story issue card on Project A, trying to link an Epic from Project B, which this issue card owner has read-only permission, will generate an error message, preventing the issue owner to create this story card, since this user has not enough permissions regarding Project B.

 In Jira instances with thousands of users, it could cause a possible occult performance problem in long-term scenarios, in the case of many of these "hidden" tickets happening on daily basis activities from users interacting with issue creation.



h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create two software projects
# Using a test user which has read-only (browse) permissions in the first project
# Create an issue with issue type "Epic" in the first project
# Create an issue with issue type "Story" in the second project
# On the creation screen (during Story creation) choose the first created Epic
 in field "Epic link" and submit 
#  There should come an error message.
# Clear the field "Epic link"  and submit again
# Issue <projectKey>-*2* should be created
# Browse directly for issue <projectKey>-*1*. The issue should be shown but without
transitions buttons

h3. Expected Results
No issue card should be created while the configuration settings are not met.

h3. Actual Results
The Story issue card is created, with missing transition buttons. It will be searchable but won't appear on the Backlog page.

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Story card being created despite an error message stating that it was not.

fields.description:
Hello

Our organization has been hunting for  a way to put the Jira Reports available in the software projects onto a dashboard.  Specifically, we would like to put the following  native reports onto a dashboard:

!image-2021-07-25-16-45-15-088.png|width=656,height=368!

 
 * Burnup charts for sprint and release
 * Burndown charts for sprint and release
 * Sprint Report
 * Velocity Chart
 * Release burndown
 * Time Tracking Report33

We think that developing a gadget that would allow organizations  to post all the available  Jira reports onto a dashboard would be game changing.  The agile gadgets currently available (Sprint Health gadget , Version Report gadget, Agile Wallboard gadget , Sprint Burndown gadget) are not the same as the  native reports in Jira.  The screenshot below is of the test dashboard we created using the existing gadgets 😢 (no bueno).

!image-2021-07-25-16-44-07-435.png|width=539,height=248!

 

Can Atlassian *please prioritize 🙏* the creation of a gadget that will allow organizations to post these reports onto a dashboard?

We also tried posting these reports on Confluence using the "status report" and "change log" macro.  This was not very helpful or what we are looking for.  

I am also a Jira consultant and many of my clients over the years have requested this feature.  I'm a bit surprised that Atlassian has not created a gadget that can solve this issue.

 

Hope to hear back from your team soon.

 

Regards

 

Lou
fields.summary: Feature request for a reporting gadget

fields.description:
h2. Summary

Users that are on devices that support gestures (Magic Mouse,
Macbook Touchpads, etc.) can accidentally trigger a back button action on
the browser.

h3. To reproduce the bug:

Access your portal, and click into a Request Type. Start filling out a form
on the Portal with data. Use a touchpad gesture (swipe left/right) to
trigger a "Back button" action on the browser.

h3. Expected Result:
The browser should trigger a warning similar to other
forms that you are about to lose your Form data and it's not saved.

h3. Actual Result:
Form data is lost, and user is shown the previous page in
their browser history.

Note that this problem is fixed on JSM Cloud.

h3. Workarounds:
Use scriptrunner script fragments and inject into the style
sheet:
{code}

body {
  overscroll-behavior-x: none;
}

{code}

This disables back gestures completely.
fields.summary: User loses form data with Back button

h3. Issue Summary

While Rate Limiting is active on a DC product with multiple nodes, the request data does not get flushed consistently from all of them. This leads to delays and/or gaps in the aggregation of this data in the UI, particularly when the data on one node never gets flushed.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Rejected request data on DC Rate Limiting does not aggregate from all nodes

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

@mention user in issue description field returns different results between issue creation and issue view.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create more than 10 users (with username starts with "A") in Jira associated with the same domain e.g: '@mail.uk' email address and another few additional users have 'uk%' in their username/full name.
 # Create an issue in Project A and attempt to @mention user by typing in '@uk' in the issue description field. Check the result of the @mention search list.
 # Navigate to the created issue and @mention user by typing in '@uk' in the issue description field. Check the result of the @mention search list.

h3. Expected Results

The @mention search results should be the same.
h3. Actual Results

The @mention search results differs.
 * Two different endpoints are used in issue creation and issue view.
 ** The @mention in Jira issue creation screen is calling the following REST endpoint:
{code:java}
<JIRA_BASEURL>/rest/api/2/user/viewissue/search?projectKey=ABC&maxResults=10&username=uk{code}

 * 
 ** The @mention in existing issue screen (issue description or issue comment) is calling the following REST endpoint:
{code:java}
<JIRA_BASEURL>/rest/internal/2/user/mention/search?issueKey=ABC-312&projectKey=ABC&maxResults=10&query=uk{code}

 * Both endpoints has the max results of 10 (first 10 results sorted by alphabetical order based on the username) but they both have different search criteria:
 ** *Issue creation:* Jira searches the keyword against user's *full name, username or email* and returns the first 10 users that has username starting with "A". The search continues to match the keyword (uk) against the first 10 users' *full name or username* and no match is found. Hence, no result is returned in this use case.
 ** *Issue view:* Jira prioritises the search of users that are involved with the issue (assignee, reporter, watchers, commenters etc). If we failed to find 10 users with the last search, the search continues to match the keyword against user's *full name or username*.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: @mention results differ between issue creation and issue view

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Activity Stream gadget fails to load if it's accessed via HTTPS with HTTP/2 UpgradeProtocol enabled. 

{code}
<UpgradeProtocol className="org.apache.coyote.http2.Http2Protocol"/> 
{code}

With the parameter, the failing /plugins/servlet/gadgets/ request is associated with H2 (instead of HTTP/1.1) protocol.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Deploy Jira 8.13.8
# Add another HTTPS connector to Jira with 
{code}
<UpgradeProtocol className="org.apache.coyote.http2.Http2Protocol"/>
{code}
# Restart Jira
# Access Jira over HTTPS and check the activity stream gadget

h3. Expected Results

Activity stream to load without any issues. 

h3. Actual Results
# From the HAR file, /plugins/servlet/gadgets/ifr request is returned with HTTP 500 response:
# NullPointerException is logged in corresponding log: 
The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{code}
2021-07-14 19:00:41,554-0400 https-openssl-nio-443-exec-14 ERROR      [c.a.j.web.servlet.InternalServerErrorServlet] {errorId=78bb5031-7e6b-410b-90f7-c08240c4ee6e, interpretedMsg=, cause=java.lang.NullPointerException, stacktrace=java.lang.NullPointerException
    	at java.lang.String.replace(String.java:2240) [?:1.8.0_275]
    	at org.apache.shindig.gadgets.DefaultUrlGenerator.getBundledJsUrl(DefaultUrlGenerator.java:85) [?:?]
    	at org.apache.shindig.gadgets.render.RenderingContentRewriter.injectFeatureLibraries(RenderingContentRewriter.java:221) [?:?]
    	at org.apache.shindig.gadgets.render.RenderingContentRewriter.rewrite(RenderingContentRewriter.java:144) [?:?]
    	at org.apache.shindig.gadgets.rewrite.DefaultContentRewriterRegistry.rewriteGadget(DefaultContentRewriterRegistry.java:75) [?:?]
    	at org.apache.shindig.gadgets.render.HtmlRenderer.render(HtmlRenderer.java:77) [?:?]
    	at org.apache.shindig.gadgets.render.Renderer.render(Renderer.java:78) [?:?]
    	at org.apache.shindig.gadgets.servlet.GadgetRenderingServlet.render(GadgetRenderingServlet.java:58) [?:?]
    	at org.apache.shindig.gadgets.servlet.GadgetRenderingServlet.doGet(GadgetRenderingServlet.java:93) [?:?]
    	at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:626) [servlet-api.jar:?]
    	at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:733) [servlet-api.jar:?]
    	at com.atlassian.plugin.servlet.DelegatingPluginServlet.service(DelegatingPluginServlet.java:37) [atlassian-plugins-servlet-5.3.11.jar:?]
    	at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:733) [servlet-api.jar:?]
    	at com.atlassian.plugin.servlet.ServletModuleContainerServlet.service(ServletModuleContainerServlet.java:47) [atlassian-plugins-servlet-5.3.11.jar:?]
    	...
    , referer=https://<baseurl>/secure/Dashboard.jspa?selectPageId=21001, servletErrorMessage=
{code}

{code}
# Restart Jira

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Jira 8.18.x has PostgresSQL driver version *42.2.16*. This version has a bug that breaks support for PostgreSQL instances in Microsoft Azure due to broken gssEncMode. 

Example of errors from logs:
{noformat}
< 2021-06-21 14:17:41.854 MSK > FATAL: unsupported frontend protocol 1234.5680: server supports 2.0 to 3.0
< 2021-06-21 14:17:41.863 MSK > FATAL: unsupported frontend protocol 1234.5680: server supports 2.0 to 3.0
< 2021-06-21 14:17:41.870 MSK > FATAL: unsupported frontend protocol 1234.5680: server supports 2.0 to 3.0
{noformat}

h3. Suggested Solution
Upgrade bundled PostgresSQL JDBC driver to *42.2.23+* version

h3. Notes
* This was reported to PostgreSQL at [Fallback for gssEncMode connection mode is not working as expected · Issue #1868 · pgjdbc/pgjdbc · GitHub|https://github.com/pgjdbc/pgjdbc/issues/1868]
**  Driver 42.2.18 includes a fix for this bug
* [fix: properly set cancel socket timeout|https://github.com/pgjdbc/pgjdbc/pull/2044]
* related problem in Confluence CONFSERVER-60515
 
h3. Workaround 
Upgrade driver manually
fields.summary: Upgrade PostgresSQL JDBC driver to 42.2.23+ version

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, certain columns in Jira's database is set to ntext/text data type. Example of this is changeitem table:

{code}
jiradc=# \d changeitem;
                      Table "public.changeitem"
  Column   |          Type          | Collation | Nullable | Default 
-----------+------------------------+-----------+----------+---------
 id        | numeric(18,0)          |           | not null | 
 groupid   | numeric(18,0)          |           |          | 
 fieldtype | character varying(255) |           |          | 
 field     | character varying(255) |           |          | 
 oldvalue  | text                   |           |          | 
 oldstring | text                   |           |          | 
 newvalue  | text                   |           |          | 
 newstring | text                   |           |          | 
{code}

In [ntext, text, and image (Transact-SQL)|https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/sql/t-sql/data-types/ntext-text-and-image-transact-sql?view=sql-server-ver15], Microsoft has added this announcement:

{quote}
IMPORTANT! ntext, text, and image data types will be removed in a future version of SQL Server. Avoid using these data types in new development work, and plan to modify applications that currently use them. Use nvarchar(max), varchar(max), and varbinary(max) instead.
{quote}

There is another comment from a Microsoft employee related to this issue:

* https://stackoverflow.com/questions/65625298/when-will-ntext-text-and-image-be-deprecated

{quote}
Small note: The types are already "deprecated". We just have not removed them from the product yet. Please move off them to the other types. The newer types are faster, support more capabilities, and you should not plan on continuing to use deprecated features whenever you can move off them. (We deprecated these in SQL 2005, so it's time to move off ;)). – Conor Cunningham MSFT Jan 11 at 14:18
{quote}

While the data type is considered deprecated, Microsoft has not got around to remove them in a newer version of SQL Server. Since the removal of the data type could cause some issues, it's a good idea to switch the data type of columns currently configured with text/ntext to different data types such as nvarchar(max), varchar(max), or varbinary(max). 

Customer has mentioned that changing the data type is essential because this also allows the database administrators to create the right covering index for changeitem that helps reduce the data lookup from primary key. This significantly reduces the CPU utilization in some scenarios.

h3. Suggested Solution

For MS SQL database, update the character type columns currently configured with text/ntext to  nvarchar(max) or varchar(max).

h3. Workaround 

None.
fields.summary: Update data type used in Jira's database

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Today it is only possible to enable or disable all Jira shortcuts. The user may find it useful to enable or disable each shortcut individually

h3. Suggested Solution
Make it possible to individually disable shortcuts

h3. Why this is important
There are situations where the ability to disable only  a few or a single shortcut could be useful. As an example, when typing a comment  the user may lost all the content if hits the shortcut 'u' by mistake.
fields.summary: Individually disable shortcuts

fields.description:
It would be really nice if we could have a mode added to rate limiting where we set a rate limit for all (or with exceptions, I suppose even) and it just monitors for rate limit exceptions and outputs those that WOULD have been rate limited.

So basically a test mode to see how your rate limit will affect users once implemented without affecting them to find out.
fields.summary: Rate Limiting Issues with Dry Run

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When running the editmeta REST API call we get archived versions which can lead to unnecessary and invalid data being returned.
Note that we are not able to select an archived version when going to the *Edit* screen of an issue.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1
Create a version in a project.
 # Step 2
Call <JIRA_BASE_URL>/rest/api/2/issue/{issueIdorKey}/editmeta
h3. Expected Results
Archived versions are not returned.

h3. Actual Results
Archived versions are returned:
{noformat}
fixVersions: {
required: false,
schema: {
type: "array",
items: "version",
system: "fixVersions"
},
name: "Fix Version/s",
fieldId: "fixVersions",
operations: [
"set",
"add",
"remove"
],
allowedValues: [
{
self: "http://localhost:48180/j8180/rest/api/2/version/10000",
id: "10000",
name: "a",
archived: true,
released: false,
projectId: 10000
},
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: editmeta REST API returns archived versions as valid options

fields.description:
By adding e.g. "http://alasian.com" to a comment in visual mode, this "text" is automatically rendered as a Link "http://alasian.com". Then, if we modify the text to "http://atlassian.com", the URL remains pointing to the old one "http://alasian.com".

As a customer, I want to have an option to disable links from being automatically rendered on the visual mode tab.
fields.summary: Add an option to disable links from being automatically rendered on the visual mode tab.

fields.description:
Affected versions of Atlassian Jira Server and Data Center allow anonymous remote attackers to  view whitelist rules via a Broken Access Control vulnerability in the /rest/whitelist/<version>/check endpoint.

The affected versions are before version 8.13.3, and from version 8.14.0 before 8.14.1.

**Affected versions:**

 * version < 8.13.3
 * 8.14.0 ≤ version < 8.14.1

**Fixed versions:**

 * 8.13.3
 * 8.14.1
 * 8.15.0
fields.summary: Anonymous users can access the /rest/whitelist/<version>/check resource - CVE-2019-20101
Implement minification for template module being referred in batch.js

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If you move an issue from one project to another and the destination project has a security scheme and the origin does not. When moving, select a security level and the issue fails to move and becomes inaccessible. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create two projects. 
# Project A has no security schemes applied to it. 
# Project B has a security scheme applied to it. The scheme should have at least 1 security level that restricts access (such as admin only or specific user). Make that  security level default security level. 
# Move an issue from Project A to B. When transitioning the issue, select the security level in Project B. 

h3. Expected Results
# Issue moves from Project A to B.

h3. Actual Results
# Issue fails to move from Project A to B.
# Issue becomes inaccessible. 


h3. Workaround
* When moving the issue, select no security level
* Add the same issue security scheme between both projects
fields.summary: Moving an issue to another project with different security schemes makes the issue inaccessible and causes the issue to fail to move

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

After upgrading to Jira 8.18, threads are stuck while the UPM is on the cache. The specific method {{com.atlassian.upm.pac.PacClientImpl.mpacApp}} is stuck on the cache.
{code:java}
java.util.concurrent.locks.LockSupport.park(LockSupport.java:175)
java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.parkAndCheckInterrupt(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:836)
java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.doAcquireShared(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:967)
java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.acquireShared(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:1283)
java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantReadWriteLock$ReadLock.lock(ReentrantReadWriteLock.java:727)
net.sf.ehcache.concurrent.ReadWriteLockSync.lock(ReadWriteLockSync.java:50)
net.sf.ehcache.Cache.acquireLockOnKey(Cache.java:3950)
net.sf.ehcache.Cache.acquireReadLockOnKey(Cache.java:3964)
net.sf.ehcache.constructs.EhcacheDecoratorAdapter.acquireReadLockOnKey(EhcacheDecoratorAdapter.java:744)
net.sf.ehcache.constructs.EhcacheDecoratorAdapter.acquireReadLockOnKey(EhcacheDecoratorAdapter.java:744)
com.atlassian.cache.ehcache.DelegatingCachedReference.getIfPresent(DelegatingCachedReference.java:123)
com.atlassian.upm.pac.PacClientImpl.mpacApp(PacClientImpl.java:202)
com.atlassian.upm.pac.PacClientImpl.unknownAppVersion(PacClientImpl.java:206)
com.atlassian.upm.pac.PacClientImpl.isUnknownProductVersion(PacClientImpl.java:198)
com.atlassian.upm.permission.UpmVisibilityImpl.isKnownOrDevelopmentVersion(UpmVisibilityImpl.java:72)
com.atlassian.upm.permission.UpmVisibilityImpl.isInstallVisible(UpmVisibilityImpl.java:45)
com.atlassian.upm.conditions.IsPermittedToView.shouldDisplay(IsPermittedToView.java:61)
...
{code}
REST API requests are processed successfully. The stuck threads identified are any user facing pages. All the stuck threads were rendering the header and footer (all threads were on this after the servlet filter stack):
{code:java}
...
com.atlassian.jira.plugin.navigation.HeaderFooterRendering$7.visit(HeaderFooterRendering.java:354)
com.atlassian.jira.plugin.navigation.HeaderFooterRendering$7.visit(HeaderFooterRendering.java:346)
com.atlassian.ozymandias.SafePluginPointAccess.invokeModule(SafePluginPointAccess.java:644)
com.atlassian.ozymandias.SafePluginPointAccess.visitPluginPointImpl(SafePluginPointAccess.java:325)
com.atlassian.ozymandias.SafePluginPointAccess.descriptors(SafePluginPointAccess.java:213)
com.atlassian.jira.plugin.navigation.HeaderFooterRendering.includeTopNavigation(HeaderFooterRendering.java:346)
com.atlassian.jira.plugin.navigation.HeaderFooterRendering$1.run(HeaderFooterRendering.java:151)
com.atlassian.ozymandias.SafePluginPointAccess.runnable(SafePluginPointAccess.java:404)
com.atlassian.jira.plugin.navigation.HeaderFooterRendering.includeTopNavigation(HeaderFooterRendering.java:148)
jsp.decorators.general_jsp._jspService(general_jsp.java:291)
...
{code}
The specific UPM version 5.0.0-2ee9e3d93d is delivered with 8.18.0:
{code:java}
         Atlassian Universal Plugin Manager Plugin     : com.atlassian.upm.atlassian-universal-plugin-manager-plugin
              Version                                       : 5.0.0-2ee9e3d93d
              Status                                        : enabled
              Vendor                                        : Atlassian
              Description                                   : This is the plugin that provides the Atlassian Universal Plugin Manager.
{code}
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Upgrading to Jira 8.18 includes the UPM version 5.0.0-2ee9e3d93d
 # Start Jira and wait for around 4 hours

h3. Expected Results

Jira should be stable and not have a problem loading pages.
h3. Actual Results

Around 4 hours after starting Jira, customer facing pages are hanging/unresponsive.
h3. Workaround
 * The PacClient hangs trying to load the version. Workaround is to [add the JVM argument|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/setting-properties-and-options-on-startup-938847831.html] below and restart Jira. This will disable the PacClient that hangs, and is not critical for Jira to run properly. The operation needs to be applied to every Jira DC node individually.
{code:java}
-Dupm.pac.disable=true
{code}
Note: After disabling the PacClient, you won’t be able to install or update apps directly from the Atlassian Marketplace. Those operations will still be available thought manual upload of the apps to your Jira instance via "Manage apps" page.

 * Same may be done via the Jira UI: System Administration -> Manage addons -> Settings (bottom of the page) -> Uncheck "Connect to the Atlassian Marketplace" checkbox -> Apply changes. Change is cluster-wide. !Screenshot 2021-07-16 at 10.10.01.png|width=447,height=78!
fields.summary: Jira 8.18.0 is unresponsive after around 4 hours due to stuck MpacApp cache

fields.description: In the Atlassian Troubleshooting and Support Tools plugin version 1.28.1 and later, there is an option to Include access logs in a Support Zip. This option is not included in our [Create A Support Zip|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/create-a-support-zip-790796819.html] documentation.
fields.summary: Add directions to Include access logs in Support Zip

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Endpoint "*rest/config/1.0/directory*" can be accessed anonymously. This page is an XML output that exposes the gadgets installed on the Jira instance.

While there are not be any identifying information, user data, or anything else available to anonymous users if they hit this URL, a potential bad actor could better understand which add-ons customers have installed into theirJira instance and use that information to their advantage to attack them. This could be through malicious attacks that exploit those add-ons specifically, taking advantage of possible security vulnerabilities of those instances, or phishing-like attacks where the bad actor may impersonate vendors to get information from us.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Access <JIRA BASE URL>/rest/config/1.0/directory anonymously
h3. Expected Results

The user gets redirected to log in
h3. Actual Results

The page is shown:

  !Screen Shot 2021-07-14 at 11.04.29 AM.png!

*Notes*
 This happens even if the public access is blocked using a flag in the dark features

This page is used by the *Jira gadget plugin* so we don't recommend blocking it as it might cause some functionalities to fail in Jira, and this was not tested.

 
h3. Workaround

Block the unauthenticated access to this particular URL **/rest/config/1.0/directory* at the network level. For example, block the URL from being accessed from the proxy side. Another option is doing it from Apache Tomcat: [How to block access to a specific URL at Tomcat|https://confluence.atlassian.com/kb/how-to-block-access-to-a-specific-url-at-tomcat-966668691.html]
fields.summary: Anonymous users can view list of installed gadgets in Jira

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
It would be great if Jira could have a configurable limit on the number of comments that can be made on issues, to avoid issues like performance and rendering when an issue has too many comments.

Perhaps we should have a setting where you can set a maximum number of comments created per time unit (say minute) after which point you need to enter a captcha to unlock the account.
fields.summary: Limit the number of comments in an issue

fields.description: This feature has been requested by many of our end users.
fields.summary: Please add the functionality to add fields (both custom and out-of-the-box) to the Add Flag and Comment Screen

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The recently disclosed vulnerability regarding Apache Tomcat
 * [CVE-2021-33037|https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2021-33037], [CVE-2021-33037|https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2021-33037] (Base Score: 5.3 MEDIUM)
 * [CVE-2021-42340|https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2021-42340] (NVD score not yet provided.)
{quote}The fix for bug 63362 introduced a memory leak. The object introduced to collect metrics for HTTP upgrade connections was not released for WebSocket connections once the WebSocket connection was closed. This created a memory leak that, over time, could lead to a denial of service via an OutOfMemoryError.
{quote}

affects the following versions:
 * Apache Tomcat 10.0.0-M1 to 10.0.6
 * Apache Tomcat 9.0.0.M1 to 9.0.53
 * Apache Tomcat 8.5.60 to 8.5.71

We should bundle a more recent version of Tomcat so that Jira is not affected by this in the future.
Current bundled version of Tomcat *8.5.68*
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Check the CVE reports:
 ** [CVE-2021-33037|https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2021-33037]

h3. Expected Results
 * Not applicable.

h3. Actual Results
 * Not applicable.

h3. Workaround
 * Manually upgrade Tomcat according to our [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-upgrade-apache-tomcat-version-used-by-jira-879957866.html].

h3. Note on fix

Jira 8.21.0 is shipped with Apache Tomcat 8.5.72
fields.summary: Upgrade the bundled version of Apache Tomcat to 8.5.68 or later

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In Jira Server and Data Center currently the only way to get back a project via REST API is to call the GET /rest/api/2/project which returns ALL projects.  There is no means to search for projects or limit the request to only those projects that contain a specific string of text in the project name or project key.  

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement a new REST API endpoint such as Jira Cloud has done over in https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-projects/#api-rest-api-3-project-search-get

Which allows a query parameter that can match against the key or name.


h3. Why this is important
It can be a costly call to force the REST API to return all the project names on an environment that has a lot of projects.  Jira Cloud also has implemented this already.

h3. Workaround 
None
fields.summary: Add REST API endpoint to search for projects by name or key such as /rest/api/2/project/search

fields.description:
* Customers require a group to only configure and manage DVCS accounts for development tools without having Jira Project admin permissions.
* It would be great to have a separate permission for DVCS accounts so that any user having that permission will be able to manage DVCS accounts but not necessarily have Jira admin permissions
fields.summary: Separate Permission to configure DVCS accounts

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When adding fields as columns to be displayed for a filter, only 25 results are returned. In a situation where there are more than 25 results that match the string provided in the search, the desired result may not be returned.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create multiple custom fields that contain the same word
 # In the test performed, more than 25 custom fields had the word Status in their name
 # Open a filter in the List view
 # Click Columns
 # Search for the field you're looking to add

h3. Expected Results
 * It would be expected that at least the field that matched *exactly* the string provided would be returned

h3. Actual Results
 * Only 25 results are returned, but not necessarily the one you're expecting to see. Because there is no pagination, the desired result may not be reachable.
 * !Screen Shot 2021-07-13 at 09.14.09.png|width=524,height=171!
 * In the example above, there were more than 25 custom fields named *<something> Status*. The field to be added was the system field *Status*, but because of this behavior it was not possible to add it as a column, as it is not returned by the search.

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: When adding columns to filters, only 25 results are returned

fields.description: On *My filters* tab from MS Teams chat, we can only see the default columns and fields, however, would be very useful if we could customize how we can view the issues, like adding a custom column or field.
fields.summary: Have the ability in MS Teams chat to customize fields and columns

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When trying to use another Jira URL and comment an issue using markup syntax in visual mode the link gets broken and doesn't work, seems like the link "disappears".
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Installed a fresh Jira instance on version 8.9.0 (also 8.10, 8.16.1, and 8.17 for troubleshooting purposes)
 # Created a project with two issues, Issue 1 and issue 2.
 # Opened Issue 2 and copy the Issue URL from the browser.
 # Opened Issue 1 and comment on the issue using visual mode adding the URL using markup syntax {*}[text|url]{*}.
 # Transitioned to text mode and returned to visual mode and then saving the comment.
 # These steps were reproduced on Firefox and Google Chrome.

Also
 # Opened Issue 2 and copy the Issue URL from the browser.
 # Opened Issue 1 and comment on the issue using text mode adding the URL using markup syntax {*}[text|url]{*}.
 # Transitioned to visual mode and added some more text and returned to text mode and then saving the comment.
 # These steps were reproduced on Firefox and Google Chrome.

A Screen record was done performing the steps.
 * [Results from Firefox|https://share.getcloudapp.com/z8ukDRBP]

h3. Expected Results

Using markup syntax, the URL shouldn't get broken or disappear.
h3. Actual Results

When transitioning between Visual mode and Text Mode after using adding the URL using markup syntax, the URL disappears after saving the comment.
h3. Workaround

Instead of using Visual mode to add a link using markup syntax, performing it from Text Mode and add the any other necessary text to the comment before transition to the visual mode save the comment.
fields.summary: Link gets broken if tried to comment an issue linking a Jira URL on Visual Mode/Text Mode.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Upgrade Jira using Linux installer is keep adding open file limit entry instead of checking and replacing an existing entry in *"/etc/security/limits.conf"*
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Upgrade Jira using Linux installer

h3. Expected Results

File *"/etc/security/limits.conf"* already contains an entry for the user as below and hence it should not add another entry.
{code:bash}
jirauser hard nofile 16384
{code}
h3. Actual Results

Test case: Installed Jira 8.5 and upgraded to 8.13.8->8.15.1->8.16.2
 File *"/etc/security/limits.conf"* contains 3 entries for ubuntu user now.
{code:bash}
jirauser hard nofile 16384
jirauser hard nofile 16384
jirauser hard nofile 16384
{code}
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Upgrade using Linux installer is keep adding open file limit entry instead of checking and replacing an existing entry

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

It is possible to add a *User Picker Custom Field* or *Group Picker Custom Field* to Jira's Project Permissions, to have a specific set of users or groups granted permissions on an issue by issue basis.

The permissions are only granted upon saving these field values to an issue. This means that the permissions are not respected during Issue Creation, as the field value being set on the Create Issue form does not mean it has been saved yet.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
(i) We will use *Assignee* as our example, though this can apply to other permissions, such as *Reporter*

 # Create either a *User Picker Custom Field* or a *Group Picker Custom Field*, and associate it to all of a Project's screens
 # Grant the *Assignable User* project permission in the Project to either *User Picker Custom Field* or *Group Picker Custom Field* depending on which you'd like to test
 # During issue creation, set the custom field in question to the User or Group value that you'd like to add as an Assignee
# Attempt to select an Assignee that only has permissions granted to it via the custom field

h3. Expected Results

Users granted the Assignable User permission via the custom field are selectable as an Assignee

h3. Actual Results

Users part of the User/Group Picker Custom Field cannot be selected as an Assignee

h3. Workaround

Issues must be created without the intended Assignee/Reporter/etc., and the *User/Group Picker Custom Field* value must be set in it's own edit operation, before the permissions are reflected on those User/Groups. The Assignee/Reporter/etc. may then be set in a separate operation afterwards.
fields.summary: Respect User or Group Picker Custom Field permissions when creating issues
